questions.question: What is the empirical formula of SCU-101?
What method was used to confirm the phase purity of SCU-101?
How does the sorption capacity of SCU-101 for ReO4- compare to that of Mg-Al-LDH according to Table S4?
questions.answer: SCU-101 has a significantly higher sorption capacity for ReO4- than Mg-Al-LDH.

questions.question: What is the maximum sorption capacity (qm) of SCU-101 for ReO4- as fitted to the Langmuir model?
True or False: SCU-101 exhibits excellent reusability for removing ReO4- with no significant change in sorption capacity after four sorption/desorption cycles.
What is the role of oxalic acid in the synthesis of SCU-101?
questions.answer: Adding oxalic acid increases the crystal yield of SCU-101.

questions.question: True or False: The structure of SCU-101 remains unchanged after immersing in aqueous solutions with different pH values ranging from 2 to 14.
What is the distribution coefficient (Kd) of SCU-101 toward ReO4-?
True or False: The removal percentage of ReO4- by SCU-101 is significantly affected by the presence of SO4^2- even at 6000 times excess.
What experimental technique was used to directly unravel the sorption mechanism of TcO4- in SCU-101?
True or False: The calculated binding energy between TcO4- and the SCU-101 framework is -20.42 kcal/mol.
What is the effect of gamma irradiation on the structure of SCU-101?
questions.answer: The structure of SCU-101 remains intact after gamma irradiation.

questions.question: True or False: SCU-101 can selectively remove TcO4- from waste solutions with high ionic strengths.
What is the role of the tipm ligand in the structure of SCU-101?
questions.answer: The tipm ligand serves as a 4-connected node in the porous 3D cationic nickel-tipm extended framework.

questions.question: True or False: The sorption of TcO4- by SCU-101 is unaffected by the presence of large excesses of NO3- and SO4^2-.
What is the significance of the SOF (site occupancy factor) in the crystal structure of TcO4- incorporated SCU-101?
questions.answer: The SOF indicates the proportion of TcO4- anions resolved in the electron density map, providing insights into the sorption mechanism.

questions.question: True or False: The sorption kinetics of SCU-101 for TcO4- is slower than that of commercial resins.
What is the effect of adding additional oxalic acid during the synthesis of SCU-101?
questions.answer: It increases the crystal yield of SCU-101.

questions.question: True or False: The sorption capacity of SCU-101 for ReO4- is higher than that of SCU-100.
What is the role of the electrostatic potential (ESP) distribution in the sorption of TcO4- by SCU-101?
questions.answer: The ESP distribution helps to identify areas within SCU-101 that offer favorable interactions for accommodating TcO4- anions.
